Reviews.Content: when we enter the hotel it was refurnished, we were welcomed with great reception by the reception staff prit. we had book a double room but we requested for a more spacious room then the reception staff prit initiated and confirmed with manager and we were upgraded to a suit room 518. it was well maintained and hygienic and highly satisfied with the hospitality. would surely recommend friends and family to visit.

Reviews.Title: “very central to london”
Reviews.Author: basil97
Reviews.Content: less than 5 mins walk from paddington station. very close for eating out, staff very good. The only thing is and it is not a complaint it is noise. but for a large hotel you really can not moan. plus the price was a bargin and it was clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Onlinebabe
Reviews.Content: We only read the reviews for this hotel on the train to London! Oh No! we where going to Radio 2 in Hyde Park for our wedding anniversary and now the reviews where telling us that we might be coming home with bites from ‘bed bugs’ Panic!!! Arrived at hotel at 1.15pm, we had booked a superior room and when checking in my husband was informed we had been automatically upgraded to a ‘club room‘, we had to wait till 2pm for the room, which was fine. The room was 007 on the ground floor, it was an average size room, clean and smart, with a mini bathroom. We had booked a double bed but where given a twin beds pushed together, but it was ok, husband checked the bed before we even considered unpacking, no bed bugs in sight!!! The room had a fridge (empty), a microwave, tea and coffee and a flat screen TV. No complimentary bottle of water (shame). So off we went for a fantastic afternoon and evening at Hyde Park, came back to a roasting hot bedroom. The air conditioning was very noisy and did not blow anything out, my husband tried to adjust the room temperature control without any joy, there was a vertical floor standing fan, which kicked out a bit of cool air but it was still very hot, very poor nights sleep, we did not complain as it was late at night and did not see much point as we where only there one night. In the mini bathroom, which was modern but cramped in, a modern shower had been put in a small shower cubicle totally wrong and did not work, the cubicle was to confined and the large shower head on the ceiling meant your hair got wet, thank goodness for the shower cap! The towel’s in the bathroom very tired and old. The next morning we had no idea when breakfast was as there was no information in the room, I rang reception at 9.15 to be told we had till 10am. The dining room was full, and there was not much choice, that’s when you did eventually find a plate, we where not offered tea or coffee, so my husband had to ask for coffee. We appreciate that London hotels have small rooms as they try to cram in as many rooms as they can in, but I am glad we where giving a ‘club room’ I would hate to think how small the other rooms might be??? Yes we would stay here again, but only if the Best Western Cromwell Hotel was full.

Reviews.Title: “Small room!!!!!!! yea real small”
Reviews.Author: dicke-nz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after a buisness trip to austria. great location close to railway station and other places for eating and drinking etc. The rooms are very very small (too small) the shower is a joke. I am not a big person and could not move in the shower. There were broken or loose floor tiles in the bathroom which caused it to pinch the skin on my foot, very painful. The cleanliness of the bathroom was not up to a good enough standard. The staff were ok, the guys on the doors were very helpfull, the people behind the counter were average, no interaction with customers, had to ask 3 times for a remote and after 45min hey presto 2 arrived in 5 min, you need to sharpen up your act front staf.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER EVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: Thank God that there are sites like tripadvisor to share our disappointment from our stay in the Best Western Paddington. I booked a trip in August for me and my boyfriend who had birthday the same month so i decide to surprise him and take him to a nice restaurant in west end. I called few weeks in advance to confirm my booking and to make sure the stay will be pleasant. When i called the reception they assured me everything was fine and the room i booked was very nice. The real disappointment came on arrival when after 10 mins waiting at the reception the stressed and nervous receptionist finally decided to greet us by throwing the registration card asking for the payment saying that the room will be ready at 2pm. I kindly asked the black haired receptionist | her name was Marian or Maryna not sure| if there is any chance to check in earlier. She called housekeeping and was on the phone speaking in a foreign language for more than 5 mins. Finally the conversation finished and without even looking at us pointed one of the bell boys to leave our bags saying the room will be probably ready at 13.30 and this was the best she can do. Compare to reception staff attitude all bell boys were very kind. We had lunch and came back to hotel hopefully to have the keys to our room. The rude girl was not there so it was a relieve for us but another girl and boy speaking indian were on shift . I asked the boy if i can collect the key he turned to the girl and ask her something in the unknown asian to us, she called housekeeping and finally it was confirmed that we can have keys.When we reached the room the key didn't open the door so we had to go back to the reception. Unluckily the rude lady who checked us in was back and seeing us changed her face expression from normal to grumpy. We asked for a key and instead of giving us another pair she shouted to one of the bell boys in her language. Not amused by the unprofessional service we headed off to the room. The room was ok smelled a bit weird but not bad. The same night the tv stopped working so we called reception 3 times to beg somebody to fix it. Finally nice young chap from the maintenance came and fix it.Also we asked few times if is possible to speak to the manager but it seems he was always in a meeting. Next morning we were leaving so we called reception to book us a taxi in 5 mins. We came down in 15mis because nobody called us ,the taxi was not there and we asked if is possible they to call because we were late for our train . The unpleasant lady again was there and she said we can flag a black taxi and that the one that they called is probably gone. We didn't say anything and left furious to try to get a taxi. We were so gutted and disappointed of our stay that we will never return to this hotel. Reading here all the comments we were lucky not to be bitten by bed bugs!!!!! Management must seriously take actions against their staff attitude and unprofessional service rather then being in a meetings or use it as an excuse all the time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving - disgusted”
Reviews.Author: hilly h
Reviews.Content: Where to begin... Avoid street level in particular the basement (and also known as "the pit of hell"). It appeared someone had put a loud speaker in our room as every sound throughout the hotel reverberated through our walls and we painstakingly endured 3 hours from 2am until 5am of these drumming droning noises (if anything, it sounded like the room/s above where having a "who can jump the highest and loudest" jumping competition). After the 7th time of making the front desk management aware of the loud noises and our inability to sleep, we finally gave in at 5am and moved to another room across the street. Under no circumstance should a couple have to move rooms due to other inappropriate and ignorant loud guests after doing nothing wrong. The front desk management continuously said time after time that he would deal with the situation and to our disgust nothing had been dealt with. My partner suggested calling the police as the noise was beyond appropriate and was not easing, to which the front desk management said "no" and refused to. This was brought to the attention of the lead manager the next day to which we were offered a discount in the "club room" that evening. After having no sleep we agreed too and we're slightly regretful after reading the reveiws of the bed bugs and I have to say having left the hotel just this morning we were itching all the way home and also suspected some other itching during the breakfast buffet. Eeek! We will never return to this hotel again. hilly and hoff

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here or use group”
Reviews.Author: phil679
Reviews.Content: booking was wrong and had to pay twice and moved to different hotel, reservations not helpful, room was change as first one so small it was a joke, second room no air con only water dripping from it all night, TV not working, broadband not working. tape on floor looked like to was to cover carpet were water had damaged it.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location, renovated hotel but wish rooms were a bit bigger”
Reviews.Author: AhmedFN
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from Paddington so you great for taking the train to Heathrow. Walking distance from Hydepark too! Good restaurants around, recommend the Swan Pub nearby. Relatively neat and clean. Bed comfort AVERAGE, but I have been spoiled before. Good but only Wired internet connection in the rooms, so bring along an access point if you want to use your iPad. Much more affordable than other hotels of comparable state and area. My only discomfort was room size, especially the bathroom, I'm 6 feet tall, so even fitting my legs in that ultra bathroom was a challenge.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES!!”
Reviews.Author: Jpat15
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before, but I feel I need to share my experience of this hotel. We booked a room for 2 nights in summer, it was reasonably priced. We arrived and were greeted with hostility from staff. The room we were given was a box. However, it was only for 2 nights so this didn't bother us. We woke up after our first night, to discover our legs covered in bites. The hotel had obviously not dealt with there be bug infestation they had 6 months previous. We told the hotel and staff members overhearing our complaint laughed. This is not a hotel I would recommend and definetely will not b returning.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy room and useless staff”
Reviews.Author: CinOxford
Reviews.Content: We got there and a nice and friendly receptionist offered to 'upgrade' our two rooms to what they call 'Club Room' (which as we discovered later means not as horrible as the regular rooms). One of the rooms (307) was close to the lift and it was like having in your room all the people chatting outside waiting for the lift. The room was filthy (see pictures), shower was mouldy and doors were covered in greasy fingerprints, the bed spread hadn't been washed for ages and the toilet seat didn't look that clean. They said the other room was 004 but that it was not clean yet so we could do the check-in later. When we got there at night they said that they were giving us what they said was one of their best rooms - in a different building! The room was in a basement and it was tiny. They finally found one in the main building but it was an inferior category (tiny and the bathroom door couldn't even be opened fully because the toilet was on its way) and I told them it was not right to downgrade us after upgrading us. The receptionist didn't seem very interested in finding a solution. In the end after complaining and seeing rooms for half an hour they offered us a more or less decent room - in the other building's basement, though. Next morning I complained to the manager and he didn't seem that interested in what I was telling him.

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: Deerwood
Reviews.Content: It is hard to reconcile the great range of reviews for this hotel, they seem to range from excellent to terrible. I do not doubt the veracity of the bad reviews but I can only write a review based upon my own experiences and, quite frankly, that was great. I stayed at the hotel for two nights with my wife. We were very pleased with the room; it was clean, and well maintained. The bathroom too was very clean and well appointed. My only gripe would be that there was no bath in the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and, I have to say, there was no sign of bed bugs as reported elsewhere. The room was too warm, though I daresay the air conditioning would have solved that if I could have worked out how to work it! We did not dine at the restaurant, though the menu looked reasonably priced though without a great choice of items. We did have the breakfast, which was very good, had a wide choice of items. Though the toaster was set too low to toast sufficiently and there was no marmite ... disgraceful! The location was good, being close to Paddington station and also Hyde Park, There were, however, no outstanding views to be had from this hotel. At the time of our stay, the hotel was undergoing some modernisation or rebuilding, which did cause some disruption, especially during check-in. However, the staff were very friendly and most amenable. This is a hotel I would consider staying at again and I would urge others to overlook the bad reviews and to give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Mike T
Reviews.Content: the staff especially arena was very helpful and nice and tried their best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: Juan_C_Acevedo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a charming street, very close to two tube stations (Paddington and Lancaster Gate) within 5-10 minutes walk. The Paddington station is the terminus of the Heathrow Airport express train. It is a very convenient location for visitors to London. While the room was very small and the building oddly configured, it was clean and well-maintained. Service was good. Overall this hotel is an excellent value for the money. Location is its best asset!

Reviews.Title: “All the bad comments are true!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Celia H
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel and had to be moved twice whilst we were staying there. The first time was because the air conditioning did not work properly and also the room was tiny. The second room was a bit bigger but after two nights my partner woke up with bites all over him. After some investigating, we found bed bugs in the bed and evidence of bed bugs in the seams of the mattress. When we reported this to the hotel staff, they did not seem too concerned or surprised (ie this has happened many times before!!!) and moved us to yet another room. This room was alot bigger and we checked the mattress and it appeared to have no signs of bed bugs. We had a peaceful nights sleep in this room although the air conditioning unit was leaking throughout the night. In conclusion, I would highly recommend that you do NOT stay in this hotel. The staff were friendly but having a hotel with bed bugs is just unacceptable. I don't know how this hotel got three stars. The pictures of the rooms do not match up with the rooms we stayed in also.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean with good location”
Reviews.Author: darkangel1
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good. Rooms very very small but clean however can hear noise from neighbouring rooms. Did have a problem as no hot water, raised this at reception and the girl just shrugged and said it was reported - she had awful attitude. Would rate hotel at 3* not 4* Would stay again if could again get a cheap deal, overall average clean hotel

Reviews.Title: “Poor Rooms... Good Location...”
Reviews.Author: coldon602
Reviews.Content: Literally booked last minute (night before) break in London. Hotel looked good on internet so said we'd go with it and booked a deluxe room. Got to hotel and were told our room was in another building. Room was tiny, literally wasnt room for trolley bag between bed and wall!!! Went to complain that this was not Deluxe, long story short after two more rooms finally got half decent room. Room was clean well air conditioned with good TV. Manager was very helpful when we asked for bigger room. Good location close to Lancaster Gate Tube... Few nice pubs close by and handy for a walk in Kensington Gardens. In general convienient location clean rooms but very small no baths in rooms and staff pretty helpful... But dont think we'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel,stunning location,will book in future..”
Reviews.Author: quddusi1
Reviews.Content: Me and friend stayed in this hotel in july 2011.Location was excellent just few minutes away from paddington station and heathrow express.Quick check in on arrival.we got good size room (032) which was club room.On arrival we got complimentary drinks.I would like to thanks Very freindly porter (John) who helped us with our bags.

Reviews.Title: “I loved my stay, i'll be back soon”
Reviews.Author: Travler072711
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is near the center of Londen. A 5min walk from the hotel is the UNDERGROUND (Metro) PADDINGTON, where it will direct you to the attraction you want to go. The staff personnel were very professional and helpfull and, when a problem in my room arose, Mr. Swapnil. D a Hotel representative moved me to another nicer room. The only downside is that the hotel key cards de-magnitize wh en in contact to eighter cells/other cards. So when you come back to the Hotel from your excursions, stop by the reception to have the key magnitized to save you the trouble of coming back down to them if your key does not want to key in. Enjoy your travel

Reviews.Title: “Business friendly and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: pradipta1120
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for more than two weeks on recent business trips to London.Must compliment the sincere attention of the hotel management staff who took care of our convenience and choices to support our requirements.Flexible,friendly and smiling,all our requests were attended promptly. The hotel is convenient for business travellers and also people on short trips who bank on good connectivity.

Reviews.Title: “always in mind”
Reviews.Author: Jeab503
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for our holiday with family and we would like to A special ..Mr. Chetan Sharma Besides the professionalism and kindness in welcoming appreciation Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms. Good location”
Reviews.Author: GLCM87
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room but was not prepared for how small this room actually was. I could nearly touch both walls at the same time. The room itself was nicely finished and very clean, I couldn't fault that at all. The bathroom was also tiny and the whole thing felt quite claustrophobic. I read a review on here about bed bugs which is disgusting but I didn't have any problems. I would say however that it is pretty overpriced. You could probably find a cheaper option that is just as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfrotable and efficient”
Reviews.Author: superpup
Reviews.Content: After we booked this hotel, we read some very negative reviews and were worried that it would be dreadful but we arrived to find a bright, welcoming reception area, with helpful and friendly staff. Admittedly, the room was very small but it was clean, well-appointed and quiet, with a comfortable bed. The bathroom though small was clean, with an excellent shower. Some people were obviously unfortunate but we would recommend this hotel, as being reasonable value for money, in an excellent location close to Hyde Park. Two small negatives - the reading lights were awkward and we couldn't work the air-conditioning, but we didn't bother to complain about this, as we managed OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: BusybeeDublin
Reviews.Content: On the plus side: Hotel well located near to Paddington and Lancaster Gate tubes. There are several restaurants within 5 mins. walking distance. All staff very nice, polite and helpful. We had a problem with sink - it was fixed immediately. Room was very quiet and spotlessly clean. On the minus side: We booked a "club" room - it was tiny! Can't imagine what the standard rooms are like. Bathroom likewise was absolutely tiny - had to open door to make room to dry oneself. Breakfast room (small) in the basement. At busier times, need to wait for a table. Breakfast was poor - poor selection, hot buffet was lukewarm!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Shaftesbury Paddington Court Hotel and would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: angeleyes1955
Reviews.Content: So disappointed with our stay at this hotel. Probably the most I have ever paid for a 2 nights stay at a hotel and I thought with it being Best Western hotel it would have been a bit of class. How wrong could we have been!!! We were taken down the road to the sister hotel first to be given a room which was supposed to be an upgrade as the hotel we booked was full. They offered us a room where you could only get into bed at one side as the other side was up against a wall,it was dark and dismal and just awful. We complained and were shown other rooms which were not much better. Eventually after spending nearly two hours trying to find a room which we felt was something like we booked " a deluxe room" we went back to the original hotel to complain again, we were told there was a plumbing problem?? not our problem we said. We were then offered a club room in the basement, we were shown the room which to be honest was still not the best, you could hear the underground trains down below! but we had to accept it as we were on our way out and were then left with half an hour to get ready when we should have been relaxing in our luxury hotel break! We were offered 10% discount 2 free breakfasts and a warm bottle of white wine .... then the light didnt work in the shower room and taps hanging from the wall..... I have emailed the manager who has not yet had the courtesy to reply. I was so disappointed with my stay at this hotel but one of the staff was very nice Preeta. Thank you Preeta for doing what you could in the circumstances. I do not think this hotel should really be under the label of Best Western, it desperately needs an update. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “will get back wid family and friends sooonnn loveddd ittt”
Reviews.Author: nada16
Reviews.Content: location was good..rooms were small, special thankz to ravi,abdul and preet .

Reviews.Title: “The experience was amazingly awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Faria2020
Reviews.Content: well overall the service and staff is really good... specially Miss.Preet remained very helping at times and her warm and welcoming smile won our heart.... I would surely love to stay here next time I visit!! "BEST WESTERN Shaftesbury Paddington Court London ROCKS!!!"

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms and poor decor throughout”
Reviews.Author: fairdoc1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel via Last Minute.com Top Secret hotels. The location and appearance from the outside are good. However, the "superior double" room was tiny. The bed was small yet took up most of the floor space and could only be accessed from one side (even the end was blocked by a wardrobe). Less abled/elderly people would not be able to stay here. The bathroom was tiny and the shower virtually impossible to get into (the doors only opened 6 inches!) The window was either wide open or closed - there was no inbetween and the sheets were stained. We have stayed at many other Best Westerns previously and have been satisfied with the room - but this hotel really lets the name down. The same complaints have been made on this site for a long time but it seems no improvements have been made.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny Tiny Rooms and They Charged the Wrong Credit Card”
Reviews.Author: Jimpame2
Reviews.Content: Yes, i know the rooms in Europe are small. The single was just ridiculous. There was nowhere to put your bags because there was a small strip of floor. They installed toilet that is completely impossible to sit on straight because of the wall 5 inchs in front of it. I am not kidding. If you are over a size 12 you need to grease yourself up to get in the shower. I had to go sideways one leg and arm AND breast at a time to get in. They spent all this money on lovely furnishings, but jammed it all in a room the size of my closet. The bed was comfortable though. I had reserved on one (business) debit card and when I got there I made it very clear to use the credit card I presented to them in person for the room charge. But of course, the barely speaking English people IN England did not do this. So my business account went into overdraft for $185 on less than $50 in purchases. I am furious. The stay cost me almost double because of incompetent front desk people! If it wasn't possible to change cards they should have told me and I would have made money available. But the tea and coffee in the rooms was delicious. (:~l

Reviews.Title: “It's very good and it has good customer service !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Turkistaniamal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good place and nice room and customer service beter than any hotel in London the customer service help you any time !!!!!! and Swapnil in the night team it's very good he help any people in any time .......

Reviews.Title: “Spoilt the end of a lovely holiday”
Reviews.Author: Bhoops2011
Reviews.Content: I took the trouble to book in advance. I booked a club room at this hotel. On arrival I was allocated a standard room as if this was what I had booked. The standard room with a double bed was shocking. There was no space. The only access to the bed was from one side. The bathroom contained a miniscule shower cubicle. Amidst feelings of despair, I checked my electronic booking confirmation. I had booked a club room. I had already complained about the room to the reception staff who had offered to show me other rooms available in the standard category. On confronting them with my confirmed club room booking, the only explanation that they offered was that this was the room allocated to me from the hotel chains headquarters. I was in no mood to argue an unacceptable explanation. In any event, the room was changed to a club room which was just as unacceptable in that it was small, cold and had very poor ventilation without any window views. Once again, on complaining the room was changed. The final room change did not meet our expectations as was poor value for the room tariff that I had paid. We had already spent too much time changing rooms and decided to endure the discomfort of this room and get on with the last two days of our holiday. Despite asking to see the manager, he made no contact with us. There was no further enquiry from the hotel staff as to whether the room was satisfactory or not.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoHashem
Reviews.Content: The mistake that I made was not going through the TripAdvisor to see the reviews of this hotel, we are a family of five, booked 2 rooms, thinking that this was 4 star hotel, but the rooms were too small to even put place our luggage in, we originally booked to stay for 8 nights but we immedialtey checked out after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lottielock
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through lastminute.com via their Top secret hotel scheme. You can imagine our worry when we then looked the hotel up on Tripadvisor where the reviews were very mixed. However, we needn't have worried, the hotel was just brilliant for all our needs. The manager Vinayak personally ensured that we had a very comfortable stay whilst there - this personal touch is so very rare for a chain hotel and he went the extra mile to ensure we enjoyed our weekend to celebrate our anniversary. All the staff were exceptionally courteous and pleasant, the rooms were spotlessly clean and well serviced and we were made to feel very welcome indeed as new customers. We had heard from reviews that some rooms can be small but we found our room to be extremely comfortable and quiet. The location is excellent, a very smart area where we felt quite safe walking about at late at night. It is within short walking distance to tube stations and Kensington Gardens. All in all, I would happily recommend this hotel. It offered good value for money and a perfect place to locate yourself for a London City break. We would happily return again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and close to public transport”
Reviews.Author: Jujuck
Reviews.Content: The hotel upgraded us to a suite and we really enjoyed staying here. The room was very comfortable and very close to paddington station! I would recommend this place to anyone who wants to be close to public transport.

Reviews.Title: “It was excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Teimour
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights on business and all I needed is a place to sleep, so a single was quite enough for me. The personnel are excellent in problem handling and the least you can expect is great patience and sympathy. I arrived at night and was assisted by the night shift of Swapnil and Ravi. The problem I encountered was that the hotel does not accept visa electron cards in general, so I was offered to pay cash the first night, but in the morning the manager was able to accept my VISA electron company card because it is a chipped one. The staff were very patient, and very friendly, despite my being very annoyed and irritated. The single room was excellent value for money though next time I would prefer to pay more and take a double. It was basement floor with people in the street being able to look donw into your window, so you have to keep the curtains shut. Bathroom has excellent decoration, but is very squashy, I had my knees against the wall when sitting on the toilet, nad I am not tall (170 cm). The room itself is extremely squashy too, decoration is quite good. Overall, for 100 pounds a night if all you need is a place to sleep, it is excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Ok on the outside, terrible everywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: BunnySam
Reviews.Content: We would like to tell you a little about our stay at the Best Western Shaftesbury Court Upon first imppressions the check in staff seemed of standard fodder and the reception area was alright in daylight. Our room however was an entirely different story. Our room (222) was set away from the main building off a spur from the starwells. The hallway that led to it was damp and pungent with a rooftop service door that seemed to keep making itself open up to the elements. When we arrived in our cupboard, sorry, room, not only did the tiny size take us back but also the appaling state of repair in which it is kept. The double bed filled the width of the space so that it could only be enetered from one side with the other side jutting up to the window. A modern plasma television adorned the foot end wall that was so flimsily installed and unprofessinally wired (all cables hanging under the TV) that I feared it may fall on my legs in the night. The wardrobe door was hanging off at one side, the curtains were gaping from the inadequate plastic rail and dragged on the floor making them awkward to open and close, even if they did meet in the middle, which they did not. The window was either wide open (no safety restraints) or tight shut and had a habit of flinging itself open at the slightest adjustment. The radiator cover under the window was smashed in multiple places and the wall adjacent was scuffed and scratched as though someone's bootheel had been used to keep the ripped wallpaper in place. Although we were surprised that a shower room could fit in such a tiny space, one had been shoehorned in and although judging by it's size it could have been designed by NASA it was obviously fitted by morons. The shower rail holding the shower head was swinging freely from the tiles. The shower itself dribbled a pathetic amount of water at a miserable speed making it impossible to wash your hair with the nicely provided toiletries. The shower needed a serious clean, it looked as though it had seen little but a wipe with a damp cloth for quite some time. The shower cubicle was set nearly a foot off the ground and this combined with the stairwell access and the bed positioning would make the room almost unusable to a more elderly couple. Our initial stop in the room was brief as we were in a hurry to make it out to the city to meet with friends. We were never asked at checkout whether our stay was pleasant or if everything was to our liking. We handed in our key and gladly retreated.

Reviews.Title: “The smallest but most cosy and fully equipped room I've ever been”
Reviews.Author: Enoikos
Reviews.Content: I was about to rate my review as Excellent, when I noticed that in Tripadvisor the Hotel class is mentioned as 4Stars, while in the Best Western site itself the rating is 3stars. Well for the 3stars hotel I was expecting when I booked a Standard Single room from their website, the experience received was definetely excellent and for an outstanding value for money. The "leisure-break" package included breakfast and it was far cheaper than any other offer in on-line booking engines. I guess that being a member of a loyalty scheme does pay-off sometimes. I was inittially allocated a ground floor room, but when I brought my booking request into their attention, I was promptly offered a room in the 4th floor with great view (check my picks). The room was no larger than 3x2.5 sqm but had everything including a 37" TFT screen at bed-foot that was like panoramic cinema experience. Excellent airconditioning, kettler and even a steam iron and ironing board available to freshen-up shirt/trousers before my business meeting. Free WiFi in the lounge area, great breakfast and superb location. Comfy (very soft) bed, not for those that would prefer a hard matress. I did like the capability to check emails and send free of charge electronic postcards, lying in my bed and using the TV and wireless keyboard. Literally 5 mins away from Paddington underground and Heathrow Express train terminal. This hotel is receiving mixed reviews, but for my expectations for a 3* hotel and the price paid, it was a superb stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location Good - room tiny”
Reviews.Author: STFC69
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for one night while seeing a concert in Hyde Park. The location was quite good. We booked through Last Minute who advertised 'Awesome hotel - fab new rooms'. Well it wasn't any of those. We had a problem at check in as Last Minute hadn't booked correctly. The receptionist's accent was difficult to understand. Not a great check in experience. The room - very, very small and cramped. Hardly any room round the sides of the bed and the chair and desk in the way didn't help. The bed was quite comfy for one night. All in all I'd say this was typical of many London hotels - overpriced with small rooms. Having stopped in some nearby it's better than many but don't come here with any great expectations!

Reviews.Title: “This is lovely hotel with selective staff willing to go out of their way to make your stay more enjoyable-”
Reviews.Author: Hellemaa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 4 nights with my partner. Great location well situated near paddington station and all for a very reasonable prize.Staff member specially a girl name preet who assured and helped us all the way to make our stay more enjoyable. I was given 032 but room was not what we were hoping. I just don't understand why the rude male staff ignored my request to book a ticket when she handled it professionally. I'm quite comfortable to recommend this hotel to family and friends. Eila Hellemaa.

Reviews.Title: “It's near to everything”
Reviews.Author: irfan_mohamad
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days at the hotel during this my first trip to London. Access to nearest tube station, Lancester Gate was within 5 minutes, as well as Paddington station (where Heathrow express/connect available). The scenic Hyde park was conveniently at walking distance. On the opposite corner is a pharmacy, and a well-known Tukdin restaurant which serve Malaysian halal cuisine. Walking along the way to Paddington/Lancester tube stations are few souvenir shops. Malaysian student hall is just few terrace apart. On top of that, the staffs were friendly and helpful since check-in till our check out (thanks to Swapnil and the night team). The room was efficiently kept clean and serviced. Internet in room was superbly fast, which made me stay connected with family at home. Enjoyed very much the stay, and most probably will be to the same hotel if back to London.. :-) Irfan Mohamad Malaysia

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms - not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: Anwen61
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location, and the staff members were friendly but not able to help. I didn't get the 'spacious' de luxe room (with fesh fruit) that I requested - I complained and was moved to an equally small room (but by now I was too tired and fed up to move again) which turned out to be rather dirty too (could see this in daylight). I am sorry to report that I was also bitten all over - presumably by bed bugs - which I know are a problem in London and not really the hotel's fault. I have recieved an apology from the hotel (although it took a while) and the manager has assured me that they are sorting out the bed bug problem.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Can not recommend enough!!”
Reviews.Author: Sdevon2011
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was very nervous having booked the room before reading reviews on Trip adviser, upon walking into the room discovered one of the highest standards from a hotel I have stayed inever, even beating some 4Star hotels I have been booked via work. Upon arrival we were greated by a very friendly receptionist who told us we had been upgraded from the delux double (which I had booked via bookings.com) to a delux triple suite. The room was lovely!!! Very nicely decorated and superb bathroom, large comfortable bed and even a small kitchen area complete with fridge, microwave and sink. We had a great nights sleep, with very little noise from outside or inside and a good air conditioning system which in the room. The location was fantastic, just a short walk from Paddington station and Hyde Park and amazing price just £89. I would love to stay here again would highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't book this hotel but got moved due to flooding!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tourist124
Reviews.Content: The hotel we booked got flooded the day before we were due to stay, so they moved us to this one. I was concerned due to reports of bed bugs and service, but we had an excellent stay. We were in a club room, which was large for London. The bed was two king singles put together to make a king, and was very comfortable after walking around for 10 hrs. The aircon didn't work, but was fixed within 5 minutes of us reporting it to the desk. Staff were friendly and helpful, they even stood out in the rain to get us a cab. No sign of any bed bugs. Would stay again when back in London.

Reviews.Title: “best location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: miller43
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to best western Paddington court hotel. We were very worried based upon other reviews in Trip Advisor, but from the time we entered the hotel we felt very relaxed and then our positive expectations were met easily and even exceeded. The location is perfect – just a short walk to Paddington station in one direction and minutes in the other direction to the Lancaster gate station. The hotel is large and they have 3 buildings in total. When we entered the hotel the bell boy spoke to us very politely and helped us with the luggage. When we reached the check-in desk, the receptionist were very polite with us and told us everything about the break fast timing, dinner timing and about everything. And the best thing happened to us was an free upgrade to a club room. Any hotel could have charged easily for an upgrade but here we got a free upgrade. And the room was very huge. The hotel staff treated us superbly. Part of this was because there was a high ratio of staff to guests, but it was more than this. The hotel prides itself on its service, and this is evident in many ways. For example, Sunday was a down day for us as we accustomed ourselves to the time change by remaining in our room for most of the day. We had expected that our room would not be made up that day – as would certainly be the case in most any other hotel. However the maid service showed up at 12 noon Sunday evening to make up our room! All of the staff was wonderful, but we came to have our favorites. For example, Anton’s service in Bar was effortless, gracious and attentive to detail and very friendly. He made us feel at home. Chetan on reception was very helpful and friendly, every evening what ever we asked for, we got that on time. everyone gave us impeccable service. Stayed May 2011, travelled as a couple

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: SteveJo187069
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel last week and i had to say the service was astonishing and met all my expectations. Reading all the reviews about bed bugs i can only say that even in a 5star hotel you can find bed bugs and is nothing to do with bad hygiene. I ve been dealing with building refurbishments my whole life and i know bed bugs,mice and any other type of unpleasant guests are very common in old buildings. On the day of the check in i spoke to Daisy ( i think the duty manager on this day) she was very competent on this matter and answer all my questions absolutelly briliantly.I will not discuss our conversation but my conclusion after all those reviews on here regarding the staff was not apologetic or rude is totally untrue. So people if you are trying to get any discounts this is not the way to blame the hotel or management team. I got bitten by bugs 2 years ago in one of the most expensive and posh hotels in Mayfair.Only people with no knoledge atall can say bed bugs are fault of the hotel. Every hotel have regular checks and inspections but bed bugs can be brought by guest from everywhere. y stay in Best Western Paddington was absolutelly enjoyable. The bell boys were very helpful every time me and my wife needed help even to get an umbrella for the rain, room was very clean and tidy,reception staff was always polite and pationt answering all of our questions. So i will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: travelingdogMiami
Reviews.Content: we booked 6 rooms for 2 nights and 2 of my guest got bitten by bed bugs after complaining and moved them to another room with not much of a apology no discount offered for the inconvevience. I would not recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, and will return!”
Reviews.Author: csreed1017
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 11 nights in this hotel and loved every minute of it. The room was very clean, nice and very quiet. It was even slighly larger than we expected after reading reviews of other hotels in London. The bathroom was small compared to what we have in the States, but still had plenty of room. We stayed in the main building on the 1st floor. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. It's located in a quiet residential area, but close to Paddington Station and restaurants and shops. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs for me too”
Reviews.Author: mydonut1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother a week ago and I too was also attacked by bed bugs. I woke up at one o'clock in the morning scratching and I knew exactly what it was, as I have had this before from a youth hostel. I probably had about 25-30 bites but I wouldn't dare go back into the bed. I sat in the chair till about 4:00 am, took a shower and discussed it with the staff at 5:00 am. They were really nice and helpful but I was worried as I know how hard are to eradicate. I threw my pyjamas away, bagged all my dirty clothes and the next day I bought Calamine lotion and lice spray killer to spray onto the luggage. So far they have not seemed to have travelled with me, but I urge anyone who has been struck with this dilemma, to wash or bin clothes straight away and keep luggage outside. I thought this was a one off, but when I checked the internet I saw that this has been a problem for quite some time. I did react pretty badly to them and had huge swells where I was bitten. I did choose Best Western because I know as a chain they should have regulations and standards, but they didn't. I don't mind small rooms but there is really no excuse for bedbugs especially since this has been a problem for some months. Good luck to anyone who has been bitten, and for anyone else, I wouldn't risk being attacked by these very irritating pests.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Weak for a 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DC_Attorney_11
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the majority of the reviewers on TripAdvisor: this hotel had fairly poor service and didn't offer much value, even for a three star hotel. Spend your hard earned money on some other pricey London hotel. The trip started well - we arrived early for check in, just to drop off our bags, but the front desk informed us that a room was already available. So checking in early was quite nice. The room, which was a "club room" seemed pretty standard for a London hotel - not large, but decent enough. It appeared clean, though the bathroom smelled fairly damp and there was some mold on the ceiling. On the second day, we had to call to ask for our "club level" amenities, which never appeared. These consisted soleley of: a can each of Coke, Diet Coke, and orange soda, two small bottles of mineral water, and one 18.7 cL bottle of Shiraz. These beverages were never again replaced. I have no idea how much extra I paid for being in a "club" room, but as far as I could tell, these six beverages were the only difference. Also on the second day, the air conditioner began leaking all over the floor. We called to inform the desk, and eventually had to be moved the next day because the entire unit needed to be replaced. This was probably for the best, since our room did not have a refrigerator (as was promised in the reservation). I was informed that none of the rooms in the main hotel had fridges any more "for health and safety reasons," whatever that means. So we were moved across the road to the second building. Our second room was almost identical, but did have a fridge. The air, however, didn't work at all, and the room was intolerably hot (although it was in the 50s and 60s farenheight outside). It was so warm that we could barely sleep in the room, and using the covers was out of the question. After two more days of complaining without response from management, we were moved to a third room. In the third room, the air worked OK (not great, but enough to make the room tolerable) and had a fridge. Throughout our stay, staff displayed all of the hospitality and cheer one might associate with a Soviet post office. While I was always very polite and understanding while explaining our issues with the facilities, staff seemed totally unconcerned. More often than not, they would promise to send somebody to the room, then nobody would every arrive. We had breakfast included with out stay, which I would also say is not a wortwhile value. You can get a fine, full english breakfast a few blocks away for only about six pounds per person. Breakfast was a hot bar of a few items (bacon, sausage, eggs, beans, hash browns), plus coffee service. There were also some cereals and yogurt. the coffee service, though, meant that breakfast combined the poor quality of a buffet breakfast with the slow service of a sit-down meal. So, all in all, not really all that great. most days, we just elected to grab something on the way to Paddington, which was always tastier and faster. Overall, this hotel was not a good value, even for pricey London. There are ither three star hotels with better customer service and facilities for the same money or less. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone that I liked.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: what-iz-juur-nim
Reviews.Content: I was there for 6 nights and just long story short, here are the positive and negative comments: - Air-conditioning did not work at all - Bed was just a small wooden box, uncomfortable mattress on top, really tiny - Blanket unfortunately was also very small - The noise from the street was really bad - You could hear everything through the walls, and You can be heard also, no pivacy - TV did not work at some point - WiFi was slow and cutting off all the time - No elevator, had to walk up and down - Bathroom was designed by NASA for space program only that I`m no an astronaut. + Breakfast was ok + The experience really motivated me to explore London a lot more. + The rain did not fall on my head while sleeping. Just as a tip, buy a pair of descent ear-plugs and don`n come back to hotel before 3-4 hours solid walk, this will make all the problems go away :-) For the sake of Your sanity, never stay in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest hotel room ever.”
Reviews.Author: dinner07
Reviews.Content: Booked a deluxe double bedroom for two nights, however when we opened the door to our room we were absolutely shocked at the size of the room. The double bed was directly under the window and the top and bottom of the bed touched both walls. I have never seen a single room this size never mind a double. We did complain and were moved to a slightly larger room. I will never book a Best Western hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: friendlycats1966
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful, no way should it be rated as a 4 star. We booked a Superior Double - inc English Breakfast. The room was so small and compact we felt like we were sleeping in a cupboard, the television channels did not work for the whole 3 day duration of our stay. They said on the first night of our stay there was a problem overall and the engineer was on site and it should be working in 30 minutes, this never happened. There was no iron or ironing board in our room and when we did get an iron we could not control the thermostat and were afraid to use it for fear of scolding our clothes. The hairdryer was not working and it took three phonecalls to reception to arrange for a replacement. Overall we were very disappointed with our stay and would certainly not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Hyde Park and Paddington Station - Closet-sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFr0mMichigan
Reviews.Content: Short walk from Paddington and a short walk to Hyde Park makes this a great location for a weekend in London. But..,,,,, be aware that your room will be smaller that the bathroom in many hotels! I never ate in the hotel since there were many decent restaurants in the immediate area. A useless "fitness center" - don't even bother.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chippymick
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed in this hotel on Saturday 21/05 We cannot praise this hotel enough, wonderful staff, helpful and courteous. Room very clean and tidy and large enough!! Bed very comfortable/kingsize. Very tasty cooked breakfast. All round a good deal. Parking available in nearby streets

Reviews.Title: “Everything negative mentioned about this Htel is true!”
Reviews.Author: mrbecks
Reviews.Content: Just came back after a weekend in London, unfortunatle i stayed at this "hotel" for 2 nights. The room: lets say Caravan size actually the bathroom in a Caravan is bigger. TV and wi-wi not working, walls are made from Paper i think, you can hear the people next door wispering. I sprayed the whole Room and bed with disinfect after reading comments about bed bugs etc, so i wasn't bitten ! Staff are rude and unhelpful ! paid £ 200.00 via lastminute.com without breakfast for 2 nights ! Next time i will read TripAdviser revies BEFORE i book a room !

Reviews.Title: “special thanks to the hotel employee”
Reviews.Author: rat_fink187373
Reviews.Content: well I have to say that the hotel itself wasn't really excellent. I and my wife had some problems with the TV, no refrigerator in the room, very small room,... But I have to say that Mr. Cheton was a very helpful and freindly to us. He changed my room, helped me with the TV in 2 minutes, helped me with the bike service. Because of very friendly people like Mr. Cheton I would come again and stay in this hotel. I would also recommend it very much. Dr. El-Khatib

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, good location, customer service spot on”
Reviews.Author: happybunny75
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely 2 night stay last weekend. Bought through lastminute.com deal. Only 5 minute walk from Paddington Station. Had a suite in the building across the room. Very nice. Had small kitchenette (microwave, fridge and sink). Very modern. Not much space in room, but who needs it? Breakfast quite dear (£11.95) but plenty of cafes in the area to eat at. Lots of other restaurants - Lebanese, Indian, Chinese, Italian - didn't try them but looked good.

Reviews.Title: “A good one for the solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: RicardoSarre
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right near the Lancaster Gate tube stop and very near Hyde Park. It has a bike rental stand right outside. Very convenient to Paddington station (for the Heathrow express). It has a great breakfast and very obliging and friendly staff. The room has everything you want, but the bed takes up 70% of the tiny floor space. Large people will not be able to fit into the small shower easily. Internet connection was reliable and free. The "fitness room" is little more than a jogging treadmill. So for travellers like me who do not plan to spend any more time in a room other than to sleep, who are average build, who enjoy parks and garden walks and rides, who ride the Tube, enjoy a hearty breakfast included in the price, and need the Paddington Express to Heathrow, this is a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Dispicable customer service”
Reviews.Author: whaleatron
Reviews.Content: We had no water in our room from 11pm - couldn't use the toilet or wash etc. We were told every 10 minutes for an hour that it is being fixed and will be fine in 10 minutes. After an hour of not getting anywhere we asked to move rooms as we were tired etc. We were told there were no available rooms. Now, I have worked in hotels before and the very least you would do is offer to find a room in a different sister hotel. No. Nothing. After standing at the reception desk for a further 30 minutes we were then told that a room was available and they moved us. (by this point it was 1am in the morning). There was no apology, no attempt at making us feel comfortable - no offer to use another toilet in the hotel etc. No offer of refund, complimentary items...The reception staff appeared to be dead from the neck up. I have never been so angry and let down with customer service before. This hotel should be ashamed of itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location nice hotel but can be pricey”
Reviews.Author: KitTat
Reviews.Content: It's a well run hotel, all areas spotlessly clean rooms well appointed (mine was a bit small) and a good location. The hotel is a collection of houses. No restaurant, but room service provides food and there is a breakfast room. Plenty of bars and restaurants within easy walking. We got a bargain (B&B £77) but can be pricey on other nights, but it's London! Parking can be 10 mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - free internet, near Underground”
Reviews.Author: hilloo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice at this hotel. Once in January 2010 and once in August. Main reason for choosing the place was that internet access was included in the price. And that is very important to me in my profession which is IT consulting. The first time, I was given a tiny room in which I could barely fit my suitcase. It had a correspondingly small shower cubicle where there was no place to turn around. The second time however, I got a nice room in the Paddington suites right opposite the Paddington Court with included breakfast at nearly the same price. Maybe because of customer loyalty or more likely because I got lucky that day. Or maybe it was because I came to the hotel at 9.00 am and was made to wait till 2.00 pm to get a room The fitness center had two treadmills. Most of the time these did not work. However it did not matter because I could go jogging along the Serpentine in the Hyde Park nearby. The hotel is very close to Paddington Station and the London Underground. Oxford Street, Marble Arch, Bond Street are all within walking distance. The breakfast is quite decent - if you get it included in the cost of your room. If not, it would be better to walk up the road to Raffles which gives you a very good breakfast for only 5 GBP. There are plenty of eateries nearby - Indian, Chinese and even British. If you dont like eating out, you can get readymade stuff from convenience stores nearby. So all in all a good bargain. I would like to stay here again if possible

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: SiTaylor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western for one night during a business trip. I was looking for a mid-range hotel that was good value, and as I had a lot of plans during my trip, was not too worried about the size/comfort on my room. The Best Western was a great choice, very well located a short walk from Paddington Underground Station with a lot of shops and restaurants nearby. The hotel is certainly only a 3 star property and certain aspects of service and room quality reflect that, but compared to other hotels in it's price range, this hotel stands out as superior. I booked a single room and it was located on the ground floor. It was a tiny room but very clean and quiet, which is all you can ask for. Nice touches are the free Internet connection (it was very high speed and good quality), fruit in my room, and very fluffy towels! One tip - don't pay the extortionate rate for breakfast. Would certainly consider a return visit, although if staying for longer, I'd probably pay more to stay somewhere a little more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: allankim
Reviews.Content: This is just about what I expected from an older London hotel. Neighborhood is quiet and pleasant, with Kensington Gardens, Queensway, and Paddington Station just a short walk away. Staff pleasant and helpful. The room (a standard "double") were tiny and tried to make use of every square inch of floor space. The bed was small and sagged in the middle. The floor, too, sagged in the middle, though it didn't squeak. Bathroom was clean but starting to show some wear and tear. Despite the issues I felt I got good value for money (last-minute online deal).

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Bed Bugs!! Will not stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Maximussa
Reviews.Content: Bed bugs in this Hotel. I'm not the only one saying this. Previous reviews confirmed that as well. Very bad front desk employees, as if they were forced to serve you, but the concierge was nice. Also, No refridgerators in the rooms-Internet not working all the time. Must say that the manager was very nice and very respectful. He promised to solve all the problems. Will not stay in Best Western Shaftsbury Paddington Court ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel. Wouldn't go back if they gave us a month's stay free.”
Reviews.Author: corbyst7
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed there in Oct 2009 for 2 very regrettable nights. As other reviewers experienced, we were told when we booked a Deluxe Triple at the Shaftesbury Premier Inn hotel for 117 pounds a night that our booking was confrimed but on arrival we were told that there was a problem with the hotel and our room wasn't available. Something or other about plumbing but in truth they would have simply overbooked the hotel which is a simply dishonest practice seen too often. They then transferred us to their sister hotel which was the Best Western Shaftesbury Paddington Court and gave us a small room in the basement with one small window opening into an airwell. It was so small it made Hong Kong hotels look large. Two steps and you hit furniture. Having carefully checked tripadvisor and chosen the Shaftesbury Premier Inn Paddington at Westbourne Terrace and ending up in their Devonshire hotel I cannot help but conclude this chain of hotel is practising deception but over booking guests at good rates at their better hotels and then transferring the guests to their crumpy ones which you would not have picked in the first place. Apart from the size, the hotel is a rabbits warren and there is lift to the basement and you have to navigate your way through corridors downstairs and then more corridors, then upstairs and then more corridors. Then there was the staff. Hopeless. Didn't know anything. Smiles would have been too much to expect. Clueless, cheerless, cheesy and cheated. Stay away from this hotel and from the Shaftebury. By comparison our stay at the Premier Inn Euston was a delight even if I was woken up by traffif on the 1st night.

Reviews.Title: “A NIGHTMARE. DON'T STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenifericeprincess
Reviews.Content: They stuffed up everything. Firstly, when I arrived I was told there was a 'maintenance' problem and had to go to one of their sister hotels nearby. Another couple arrived at reception after me after being sent there from ANOTHER one of their hotels and were told there was no room for them either. I've no idea what kind of business they were running, but they were mucking us all around at 2 in the morning. I'd already paid my accommodation in full and insisted they give me a room. They refused and finally, I was sent to the other hotel and then ferried back again next day. I checked back in tired and exhausted from all the mucking around. A couple of hours later, two guests opened my door as they had been given my room as well! I was in my pyjamas and shocked and appalled that one hotel couldn't book anything properly to save their lives. COMPLETE AMATEURS! Over the next six nights, the following things went wrong... 1. "Fitness Centre" comprises of two treadmills that don't work 2. Lift out of order the whole time. Had to walk up and down 7 flights of stairs. 3. Internet access kept cutting out. 4. TV didn't work properly 5. Movie cut out AFTER I'd paid for it on credit card. 6. Security card to room expired every day and had to be remagnetized. In short, TERRIBLE!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room”
Reviews.Author: eyewash
Reviews.Content: My room was very, very tiny. When complaining, reception offered me a bigger one for no charge, but why not from the beginning when you haven't unpacked your stuff. The bathroom was nice and clean but it could have been much roomier. I have been in quite a few hotels in London, so I kind of have something to compare with. Beside the small size (approx. 2.5 x 3.5 m) there was a big air gap (approx. 2.5 - 3.0 cm) underneath the door where you could see (and hear) right into the floor. The bed was sloping down on one side and the matress was quite worn out. The service was good, WIFI FOC at the lobby and at the bar. Good internet cable connection in the room, also FOC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and base to explore London”
Reviews.Author: PlayaBlancaYork
Reviews.Content: Booked a Club family room and what a fab stay we had would highly recomend. Our bedroom was on the 4th floor accessed via a lift, Room had 2 large very comfortable double beds, wall mounted flat screen tv, complimetary fruit basked and a bottle of wine good quality toilitiries in a modern and spotlessly clean bathroom with shower over the bath. All staff from reception staff to breakfast waiters were very friendly amd helpful. Breakfast room was modern and we had a lovely well cooked breakfast with good choice of juices, breads, cereals, bacon etc. Hotel 5 mins walk to underground, so in a pleasant quiet area of Paddington with a few good bars and restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel. Would certainly return to this hotel and would recommend to all. Please ask if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Western, Hotels with personality?”
Reviews.Author: mikelyons
Reviews.Content: The taxi driver from Euston knew where to go, and the journey was quite short. On arrival, we were greeted coolly, as if we were an inconvenience, and the day manager spoke poor English. We had not been informed that the room where we were staying was up 5 flights of steps and there was no lift! We had a porter to carry our heaviest bags, but we are both at an age when our knees are going and this was a hard slog. It was made harder on the second evening when we couldn't get the key card to work and I had to climb down and back up the stairs! The room was tiny for a "Superior Double" and the bathroom could barely accommodate one person’s toiletries, let alone 2. The bed was hard, rather than firm, but was otherwise clean. The TV channels available were quite limited and the air conditioning did not work. Because we were at the top of the building, of course, the room was unbearably hot so we had to open the windows to let in some air. One of these had to be propped open, as the sash didn’t work. On the second night, at 3.00am, I was shockingly awakened to a really loud argument going on in the street below. I am a very heavy sleeper. I have been known to sleep through earthquakes and coach crashes, but this argument sounded as though it was right outside the window – 6 floors up, that’s quite startling. We rang the duty manager/reception numbers on the room phone, but got no reply. We think that it was the duty manager and one of his staff having some kind of discussion, without any consideration for guests who might be asleep, at the tops of their voices. I did not recognise the language they were shouting in, but it was a very animated debate and kept us awake for a good ¾ of an hour. My partner told me the same thing had happened the first night, but that I had slept right through it. We have a video recording of part of the incident as proof that it happened. The only bright spots to this stay were the young lady who served in the bar, who was very pleasant and managed to handle our requests despite limited English and the young porter who carried our bags and who also sorted out the key problem, although no explanation or apology was given for the key’s failure. In summation, I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: rossandrewhamilton
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a night on of the suites opposite the hotel. Well equipt and spacious, The reception happily looked after our baggage both before and after we had checked-in/out. Adequate selection at breakfast. Great value and 5 minute walk to paddington station.Great

Reviews.Title: “Not all as it seems on check in”
Reviews.Author: j_pk999
Reviews.Content: We were not told lift was out of order given room on third floor , money stopped from credit card within ten minunits of check in so we could not stop payment when we decovered lift was not working, very smart no one says anything about lift until you go towards room would have stayed in one of there other hotels in london if problem was informed to us very sneeky

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable Hotel in a vibrant neighbourhood close to all amenities”
Reviews.Author: martwyl
Reviews.Content: On arrival the Front desk staff, (good work Cheetan and Parul!) were most courteous and we were automatically upgraded to a very spacious room which helped to make our 5 day stay most comfortable. We also had reserved additional rooms for family members which were most satisfactory. Staff were prompt in responding to our requests regarding laundry services and TV reception. The hotel is just north of Kensington Gardens and close to the Lancaster Gate tube, in a vibrant, clean and well lit neighbourhood with loads of excellent restaurants, including Italian, Indian and Lebenase which we enjoyed. Paddington Station is close by as is good neighbourhood shopping. We will certainly recommend the Shaftesbury Paddington Court Hotel to Family and Friends

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here! I should have listened to Trip Advisor reviews!”
Reviews.Author: TNA27
Reviews.Content: Value: We had a very dissapointing stay at the Best Western. First of all, when booking I was quoted 230 for the 3 nights. Upon confirming the booking the price had suddenly shot up to 290 pounds. On our travels this winter we usually stayed in 40eu/night hotels but realized how expensive London hotels were and wanted to stay in the same one as our visiting family. I can say that this 100 pound/night hotel was far worse than any 40eu 2 star hotel we've stayed in over the past 2 months! Service: Upon arrival the hotel staff were unwelcoming and greeting us with the bare minimum. We had to call down multiple times for things missing from the room. Although they were polite when we called down it took at least 10 minutes for the required item to arrive and someone showed up only half the time. The only shining light was our last night when a nice young man was working who was extremely helpful in getting us what we needed. The Room: We went up to the room where we could hardly fit through the front door. The door did not open all the way so even fitting our suitcases through was a struggle. The room was tiny. I have lived through staying in the notoriously small hotels in France but this was a closet. We were lucky not to have a large suitcase because I don't even know where it would have fit. The bathroom was tidy and clean but the shower was once again so small that I could hardly turn around in it! Cleanliness: Although the room seemed clean every time we got back to the room it had a disgusting smell. I think this was attributable to the tiny room. Luckily there is a window that opens onto a quiet street so we were able to air it out. Also the cleaning supplies used by the workers are kept in the hallway not in a closet so anytime you walk through to reception there are vaccuums etc. which is very untidy especially for a 4 star hotel. Sleep Quality: Although the beds were incredibly comfortable the "double bed" we shared was the smallest one I've ever seen. It was closer to a twin than a double. Location: Although the hotel is very near to two tube stations and right outside is a bike rental stand, many tube stations are closed on weekends making that convenience useless. It is very far from the city center so not taking the tube makes it very hard to reach the center. Overall for that price it should have been more central. Although the hotel is pleasant enough it should definitely not be the price they charge. You can find much better value elsewhere. It looks nice upon arrival but that's just the exterior. The service, rooms and layout definitely do not meet a 4 star standard.

Reviews.Title: “Paddington Suites Was Perfect in London!!”
Reviews.Author: Sekhmet0202
Reviews.Content: I've read all the reviews here, and can only conclude that most of the reviewers stayed somewhere else! Our Paddington Suites was about 1/2 mile from Paddington Station train and underground. The hotel is really in Bayswater, a nice upscale neighborhood, quiet, but with everything around the corner. Upon arrival, we wanted to check in, stash our bags in our room and go drop off the mess of a car (see Kendal) to Hertz at the airport. No parking of course, hence us getting rid of the car. The front desk was busy, but moving swiftly. I checked in and the clerk detailed a porter to help unload and get us into our "suite" across the street from the lobby. We had done our reading and knew the setup although we had never been there before. Got the car unloaded, jumped back in the car, returned car to Hertz and rode the "Heathrow Express" to Paddington Station--ridiculoulsy fast and easy. The staff at the front desk was going through some new front desk clerks, and some training was going on, but never without an "adult" trainer to take over. They worked quickly and tried hard to get us what we wanted/needed very quickly. They were always polite and never rude. The porters were hard-working and polite. The breakfast room personnel were hard-working and polite as well. Across the street, in the "Suites", we had our own key to the building and our suite, plus there was a small elevator. The room was rather charming-an anteroom with a large closet for coats, clothes, ironing board, etc, and also held the main thermostat. From the anteroom, through another door was our room. Very quiet, usually. We had lovely high ceilings and windows with billowiy drapes in a gorgeous bronze polysilk that went all the way to the ceiling, with sheers under. There was a desk, thoughtfully outfitted for computer or writing use. There were two different chairs for comfortable sitting and a tiny kitchenette for anything we brought to put in there! Lovely tea setup and plates, utinsils, etc. All very handy and just what we needed! The bath was clean, very modern and the shower was awesome! I tell you, My Fellow Americans, we have got to get our bathrooms up to par!!!! Plenty of clean white towels too. The bed was magnifico! Plush, comfy, lots of pillow.....dreamland came easy! The large screen tv was our lifeline when our trip to Egypt crumbled in front of our eyes.... and the staff worked with us to stay in the exact room we were in, with no break for another 5 days. In the end, when we left, I had £ 7 in my pocket as a refund from the upfront payment I made when we stayed longer! How often does THAT happen??? The hotel says they took too much and gives you change??? Over all, we loved the room, the view, the cleanliness, the service. We would gladly recommend it to friends, acquaintences and family. There are less expensive options, and I guess you have to decide what's worth more to you: cheap or no-hassle. Our hotel wasn't cheap cheap, but we had no hassles. We weren't expecting any and treated the staff with politeness and smiles. Sometimes that goes a long way!

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again, the room was a joke”
Reviews.Author: davethorne
Reviews.Content: The cupboard I had was laughably called a double room. It had adouble bed in but the only way to get to the wardrobe was to walk over the bed, really. The head of the bed was against one wall and the foot of the bed against the other. Truly a shocking room the only reason i stayed was that the room had been prepaid by my company and I was in a rush to attend a function in town. The staff attitude went from offhand outright unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Floki26
Reviews.Content: We had a very warm welcome from staff (Chetan and Paru) on arrival and they were very efficient and friendly and quickly showed us to our rooms. We had booked delux rooms but to our surprise found out that this had been upgraded to suites which was great. The rooms though abit small were very clean and comfortable with tv, fridge, microwave, hair dryer, iron box etc. The hotel is in a great location just a few minutes walk from paddington train station. We all had a wonderful experience and would highly recommend this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “A good place”
Reviews.Author: one01
Reviews.Content: I'm coming very often in London for the business purposes. I tried different hotels in London. I must confesse this hotel is well located with a reasonnable price

Reviews.Title: “Looks posh but is far from it !”
Reviews.Author: Punkwatts
Reviews.Content: Had no information on our booking so had to wait while they updated the system Our room was a cupboard - double bed pushed under window so had to climb over my husband to get in and out of the bed. Television did not work nor did the phone so was given a free breakfast - that was a joke. Breakfast was a free for all, no seats, no plates, only 2 young staff, no coffee, tea !!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended...”
Reviews.Author: WayOutWest76
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to waste too much time on this review as I would not recommend staying here... Despite having a 'Club Room' the bathroom was tiny and you couldn't move in the shower. The mattress was sagging and the bedding didn't fit properly. We were on the ground floor and were woken up in the middle of the night by someone knocking on our door (not really the hotel's fault) and then the dustbin men collecting at around 6.30am outside our window! You could also hear everyone in the corridor and what they were saying. Breakfast was chaotic, no plates and no service. Grabbed a roll and then had breakfast elsewhere! The hotel isn't that close to Paddington, others are closer, but you can park for free on nearby streets between 10.30pm and 8.30am. The room also had free internet that was okay. These were the only positives. We will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: tjz1100
Reviews.Content: I'm liking the shaftesbury groups hotels, they're cheap-ish, available, clean and friendly. Definitely on the list of repeat stay places.

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to 4*”
Reviews.Author: oliviapulley
Reviews.Content: Booked the BW Premier Shaftesbury Kensington bc I'd stayed b4 & it was good. After travelling almost 30 hours, that hotel dumped me here on arrival. Room so tiny that when you opened the door, it bumped into the desk! Also, room right on road with thin windows & non-blackout curtains, so sleep difficult (even though I warned in advance I would be taking a professional exam the next day). Phone didn't work so I couldn't call desk. Lacked basic 4* amenities (nice bedding, complementary toiletries). Reception & bfast staff good but night desk was chaos & forgot repeated requests/didn't bother to inform me when couldn't fulfil requests. Floor under bed absolutely covered with crumbs. No wi-fi in room. TV had no guide and incredible slow to flip through channels. Sink didn't drain at all. Nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not a fair swap”
Reviews.Author: Daffodils52
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Shaftesbury Kensington but they had a boiler failure and swapped us the day before saying we would be upgraded. Room very small 2 beds pushed together and not very confortable, If this was an upgrade would hate to see what the original one was like. View was a 3ft and 6ft whitewashed wall. I asked for a room with a bath but they only had showers available which were tiny as was the bathroom. The toilet seat was broken on one side but there was sufficient soap etc. The reception staff were very abrupt and weren't very helpful,they had a very much a 'take it or leave it' attitude. We ordered bar food and waited more than 40 mins for it to arrive. Breakfast was ok but not much choice and not very hot. It is close to Paddington Station and they will hold your bags for you on checkout if required. I stay in hotels regularly on business and I must say for hospitality this was very poor. You are very much treated as just a room number.

Reviews.Title: “Shaftesbury Hotels - you never know where you will be spending the night”
Reviews.Author: daisiemay
